full_text: Well, at least Willson Contreras and Ian Happ get to hug again.
I'm told no one else from the Reds was traded ahead of the deadline. Solano, Farmer, etc. sticking around.

Not gonna be any buzzer beaters from the Chicago Cubs, sources said. Willson Contreras and Ian Happ will remain with the Cubs, as @Ken_Rosenthal said.

Also staying: Carlos Rodon, Joc Pederson, Martin Perez, Matt Moore. 

Still awaiting word on the Red Sox's trade candidates.
The #BlueJays get young starter Mitch White and minor league infielder Alex De Jesus. from the #Dodgers for minor league pitchers Nick Frasso and Moises Brito.
Contreras and Happ stay with Cubs
LHP Matt Moore will remain with the Rangers, per source.
#BlueJays announce they have acquired RHP Mitch White and INF Alex De Jesus from the Dodgers in exchange for LHP Moises Brito and RHP Nick Frasso.
#Dodgers trade Mitch White to the Blue Jays for minor league pitchers Nick Frasso and Moises Brito
Rodon and Joc are staying with the Giants, I’m told
Hearing that’s it for #Rays, no additions or other deals
The #MLB trade deadline is over, but there will be plenty of trades coming down over the next 30 minutes that have yet to be announced.
Pablo Lopez is not being traded by the Marlins
Bader is currently on the DL with plantar fasciitis. The Yankees have wanted better defense in CF and to get Judge out of CF to protect his legs
Source confirms: Mets acquire reliever Mychal Givens. First: @martinonyc
Yankees are getting CF Harrison Bader for Montgomery
Yankees have sent Jordan Montgomery to the Cards for Harrison Bader
The New York Yankees are acquiring Harrison Bader from the St. Louis Cardinals for Jordan Montgomery, according to sources familiar with the situation.

Pablo Lopez will remain with the Marlins beyond the Trade Deadline, per source. The Yankees were one of the teams that tried to deal for him, but the match wasn't there. Lopez is under club control through 2024.
Cardinals acquiring LHP Jordan Montgomery from the Yankees, sources tell me and @LindseyAdler. Return not yet known.
The #Phillies are indeed getting #Angels starter Noah Syndergaard once physicals are complete. @Ken_Rosenthal on it.
Noah Syndergaard traded to Phillies
The Philadelphia Phillies are finalizing a deal to acquire right-hander Noah Syndergaard from the Los Angeles Angels, sources tell ESPN.
Twins get Michael Fulmer from Tigers, sources tell @TheAthletic.
#Rays make it official, Phillips traded to #Orioles for cash considerations. He'll reunite there with former Seminole HS teammate Joey Krehbiel.

Yankees have had fear about how Severino returns, if Taillon/Cortes run out of gas as IP build. Lopez was one reason they got other work done yesterday. To pursue something like this. Plus lots of people still in Marlin org who worked for NYY and know the prospects first hand
Orioles are adding Brett Phillips according to a source.
#Rays Phillips has a new home https://t.co/KC83fcjxmi

It now appears the Dodgers are not in pursuit of Lopez, but at least two teams are trying to land the righty in the next 35 minutes. Source said it looks like it could come down to the final minutes before 6:00 pm ET before a deal is struck or the Marlins decide to keep Lopez. https://t.co/gnZvxqhx9n
#orioles have acquired Brett Phillips per source
BREAKING: The #Batgirl movie has reportedly been completely "shelved" and will NOT be released in theaters or on HBO Max... Full details: https://t.co/PcRRrWEDv5 https://t.co/sggeJLWlxS

I asked Carlos Correa if he’d ever faced new #MNTwins starter Tyler Mahle before.

“No, but I checked his Baseball Savant and there’s a lot of red in there.”
A reliever who was of interest to #Rays https://t.co/RZ2xdyDk2E
That would seem to eliminate #Phillies interest in former #Rays CF Phillips https://t.co/aP7eJPjxhE

3 1/2 hours until deadline, sounds like #Rays are continuing talks on several fronts (likely RH reliever, maybe C) but nothing imminent as of now. Some chatter that #Yankees asked about Phillips and Choi

The Los Angeles Dodgers are in agreement on a deal to acquire outfielder Joey Gallo from the New York Yankees, a source tells ESPN, confirming @ragazzoreport. The trade, the source says, is pending a medical review and should be completed soon.

With Eric Hosmer out of the Juan Soto trade after rejecting a deal to Washington, the Boston Red Sox swooped in and will acquire him from San Diego, sources tell ESPN. The finances are unclear: Padres could pick up a chunk of money -- or could send along a prospect with Hosmer.

Padres almost certainly paying vast majority of remaining financial obligation to Hosmer - more than $7M this season, plus $39 million from ‘23 to ‘25 - in deal with Red Sox. Boston not on his no-trade list. First: @sdutSanders.
#GuardiansOfTheGalaxyVol3's High Evolutionary will be a "narcissistic, sociopathic, but very charming" villain, says actor Chukwudi Iwuji! Full quote: https://t.co/kuFFFoVx41 https://t.co/DcbOBnlshl
Disney has released the full #Marvel lineup for next month's #D23Expo, including #MarvelStudios' onstage showcase! Full schedule: https://t.co/hSRINNclE5 https://t.co/HrZd7NYxdO

The Toronto Blue Jays are finalizing a deal with the Miami Marlins, sources tell ESPN. Shortstop Jordan Groshans is going to Miami. Zach Pop and others are going to Toronto. 

Pablo Lopez is not in the deal.

With Juan Soto seemingly headed to San Diego, the Dodgers are looking at Ian Happ and David Robertson of the Cubs, per sources. Plenty of competition for both players, however. Mets said to be interested in Robertson and Willson Contreras, as well

Nats had a .337 winning percentage with Bell/Soto by far best hitters on team averaging 4th fewest runs per game. What do they look like now for 11 vs. Phillies, 8 vs. Mets, 6 vs Braves, 7 vs. Padres, 4 vs. Cardinals, 2 vs. Mariners? #ImpactTheRace

When Soto was informed by the Nationals he's moving, it was immediately clear some version of the deal will get done. The Padres knew that Eric Hosmer had Washington on his no-trade list and could invoke it. There are always different iterations.

The point: The deal will happen. https://t.co/TFH8vob1p4
@JimBowdenGM Source confirms what Jim is saying. Deal will go through with or without Hosmer. Padres still must decide what to do with him.
The #Nationals #Padres deal DOES NOT hinge on Hosmer being a part of it. The deal is done regardless...acccording to sources directly involved.
How to create chaos in baseball in four easy steps: https://t.co/k5i57lmxTk
Eric Hosmer coming in more clutch for baseball than he did during the Royals 2015 World Series run.
Soto deal will not be official until Hosmer agrees to waive his no-trade stipulation to the Nationals. To this point he has not, according to a source. Negotiations almost certainly taking place.

WASHINGTON NATIONALS - Send Juan Soto and Josh Bell to Padres for haul of prospects.

It all hinges on... Eric Hosmer waiving his NTC.

Please reject the deal, Eric. I want chaos.
With Juan Soto off the block, hearing the Cardinals are still looking to add a bat and/or pursue catching depth. Can’t rule out additional pitching either. #STLCards
Juan Soto has been informed he's being traded to San Diego, a source tells ESPN.
Jose Siri will wear No. 22 for #Rays. Had 26 with #Astros; that's taken by Ji-Man Choi
CORRECTION: The Nationals are on Eric Hosmer's 10-team no-trade list. He would have to give his consent to be in a deal with Washington.
Eric Hosmer has been notified he’s in the agreed-upon deal. He has a no-trade and hasn’t consented yet. Belief is they will figure this out however, one way or another.
Per @JoelSherman1, Hosmer also headed to Nationals.
Source confirms: Soto and Bell headed to Padres. Gore, Abrams, Hassell, Wood and Susana to Nationals. First: @JonMorosi, @JimBowdenGM. Next question: What happens to Padres’ Hosmer?
If you think the Washington Nationals situation is pain enough, just imagine how it would feel if Dave Roberts used any sort of common logic in Game Five of the 2019 NLDS.

The package going back to Washington for Juan Soto and Josh Bell, sources tell ESPN:

- LHP MacKenzie Gore
- OF Robert Hassell III
- SS C.J. Abrams
- OF James Wood
- RHP Jarlin Susana
- one more major league player

That's the only holdup right now to the agreed-upon deal.
Big-time OF prospect James Wood is believed to be in the big package going to Nats in Soto deal

The San Diego Padres are finalizing a deal to acquire superstar outfielder Juan Soto from Washington, sources tell ESPN. 

One of the biggest deals in baseball history goes down, and it sends the 23-year-old to SD, where he will team with Fernando Tatis Jr. and Manny Machado.
Padres have deal to acquire Juan Soto
The deal is NOT done according to sources.
Sources: #Padres and #Nationals have agreed in principle on a Juan Soto trade, with Josh Bell also going to San Diego. @MLB @MLBNetwork
https://t.co/cFWGjZilBs
Lot of optimism now that Nats can get a Juan Soto deal done with Padres. Nothing official yet.
The San Diego #Padres are getting close to landing Juan Soto from the Washington #Nationals. The deal is not yet finalized.
NEWS: #Nats are in process of calling up multiple minor leaguers to @MLB club — a sign that trades are imminent. @MLBNetwork
Cade Povich, Juan Nuñez and one more low-level prospect also heading to Orioles for Jorge López, source says.

The Minnesota Twins are finalizing a deal to acquire closer Jorge Lopez from the Baltimore Orioles for left-hander Cade Povich, right-handed reliever Yennier Cano and more prospects from the complex league, sources tell ESPN.
Source confirms: Twins get Jorge Lopez from Orioles. First: @JonHeyman.
Jorge Lopez to Twins. Nice pickup.

#Rays have until 6 to trade Phillips, who was DFA’d on Monday. Teams that would fit, and, per sources, have interest include #Yankees, #Phillies, #Brewers. #Cubs could also be in mix as they have some RH relievers, and a certain C, #Rays have interest in
Rays definitely in on Contreras, as @Ken_Rosenthal reported, along with Padres and Mets. TB needs a catcher

Rays in mix along with Mets for Cubs’ Willson Contreras, sources tell @TheAthletic. Possible fallback for Padres, too, if SD does not land Soto.
The Red Sox checked in with the Rays about OF Brett Phillips, who was designated for assignment on Monday.
Smith deal still not official…
Big day for Astros. Trey Mancini. Christian Vázquez. Will Smith. And possibly one more move coming. Team still looking for CF help.
According to sources, the Yankees are getting interest in Joey Gallo. It would be something of a surprise if he wasn’t traded by Tuesday’s 6:00 pm ET deadline.
Tigers are getting Braves pitcher Kris Anglin in return, per source https://t.co/NdVwFxiPLd

The #Astros have a surplus of starters and badly needed a lefty in the bullpen, and Will Smith fills the bill.
LHP Antoine Kelly also to Rangers, source says.
Nunez and Oviedo go to Pirates in Quintana-Stratton deal
MLB source: @astros trading Jake Odorizzi to the Braves for lefty reliever Will Smith.

Source confirms: Brewers acquire reliever Matt Bush from Rangers. IF Mark Mathias to Texas, per @byRobertMurray. Also on it: @MLBNerds
Matt Bush goes to Brewers in deal with Rangers @ByRobertMurray on it
The Brewers are acquiring RHP Matt Bush from the Texas Rangers.

#Rays Neander, talking to Tampa Bay media, said they consider Jose Siri (acquired Monday from #Astros) to be as good a defensive CF as there is in the game, and with extraordinary overall physical skills.
The Rays *were* among the seven contenders I reported were at Rodón’s start last night but they’re likely to have interest in several possibilities.

Bloom said his intention is for the Sox to still make the playoffs, despite trading their starting catcher.
Johan Oviedo and Malcom Nuñez headed to the #Pirates in exchange for Quintana.
